website_summaries.verdict: A heavy duty inversion table with a comfortable memory foam backrest that is adjustable from 4.3 feet to 6.5 feet.
pros: This steel-framed inversion table can tilt from 20º to a full 180º
It is rated to support up to 350 pounds
The foam rollers hold your ankles in place without pinching
Full loop handlebars give you complete control of your inversion experience
cons: As with most inversion tables, it is large and heavy, so it doesn't offer convenient storage

customer_reviews.title: full 180 inversion
customer_reviews.text: I like that this offers a full 180 degree inversion. I wasn't able to use that full inversion at first, it took a couple weeks to work up to it but now I don't use the pin to set the degree anymore so I'm glad I got a device that was capable of 180. I do find the ankle cuffs really not comfortable so what I do is use a hand towel over each leg to make it easier to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: McJeeee

customer_reviews.title: It’s solid and very safe
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together I have made five adjustments to my upper back. I go back for two minutes at a 45 degree I tried hanging straight up and down and threw out my lower back but that’s on me not the machine I am not ready for that position yet. I love it, the machine will with gravity stretch you out. I am all so 6”1 250 the machine will hold my weight easy. Locking your feet in is easy and very safe it’s a solid machine. Get it today
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: One of the best Inversion Tables on the market!
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Inversion table I have owned in the past twenty years, and by far the best! This is a "gym quality" piece of equipment. Everything from the packing, the tools provided, to the assembly instruction are top quality. Well worth the investment!
customer_reviews.author: JERRY D. BYRNE

customer_reviews.title: Love this inversion table
customer_reviews.text: This product is of high quality and very, very easy to assemble. The assembly was made easy because everything was marked clearly. Not one problem during assembly and all parts were intact. I used it the first time and forgot to screw the pin all the way in so I was totally inverted. Make sure you have someone with you the first time in case you can't get back up. I was able to get back up without a problem. I felt the pressure off my lower back after first use and I have a severe sciatica problem. I'm very happy with my investment. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: William M

customer_reviews.title: Great but heavy and hard to move around.
customer_reviews.text: Great high quality unit but its heavy and can't easily be moved around. For the price it would have been great if they put wheels on one end so you cant tilt and move it around like a workout bench. If you are limited on space and need to shuffle things around when you want to invert, I would suggest you pass on this and recommend you look for something that is more portable and possibly can fold up. If you have the space to leave it out, then its an awesome inverter and I love the shape. Looks way better than the cheapo triangle framed inverters.
customer_reviews.author: George I.

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!

So far, my only concern, is that I couldn't find in the owners manual how long to stay on it, and how many times a day is recommended.
